title: Naomichelys
text:
Naomichelys is an <a href="extinct">extinct</a> <a href="genus">genus</a> of <a href="Helochelydridae">helochelydrid</a> stem <a href="turtle">turtle</a> known from the <a href="Early%20Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> (Aptian-Campanian) of North America. It is the only member of the family known to be native to North America. 
Distribution.
"Naomichelys" is known numerous remains from western North America, most notably the holotype partial shell from the <a href="Cloverly%20Formation">Cloverly Formation</a> of Montana and a complete skeleton from the <a href="Antlers%20Formation">Antlers Formation</a> of Texas. Indetermiate remains are known extending up to the <a href="Campanian">Campanian</a> in the United States and Canada. It is the only known North American member of Helochelydridae.
Location.
After
Taxonomy.
"Naomichelys" is a member of the family <a href="Helochelydridae">Helochelydridae</a>, which is known from Late Jurassic to Late Cretaceous deposits in North America and Europe.
